title: John McDonnell's programme for the British economy is utopian, mad and catastrophic
text:
John McDonnell doesn’t come across as a rabble-rouser. The shadow chancellor wants to overthrow capitalism and has admitted he “feels physical” towards Tories.

But his carefully cultivated public image is closer to that of a vicar or professor. At the end of fiery rallies, McDonnell is the guy who stands up and lectures activists calmly about where we are in the materialist dialectic and how the capitalists are manipulating the superstructure.

It is widely understood that the shadow chancellor would like to tax a lot more, spend a lot more and nationalise a lot more. But since the Seventies, the Labour programme has undergone a snazzy update.

In a quiet, grudging way, they admit that they failed....
description: John McDonnell doesn’t come across as a rabble-rouser.
